protocol_name: CRISPR Editing of Immortalized Cell Lines with RNPs using Nucleofection
protocol_name_html: CRISPR Editing of Immortalized Cell Lines with RNPs using Nucleofection
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"e99ol","text":"This protocol describes how to deliver ribonucleoprotein (RNP) complexes that consist of purified Cas9 nuclease duplexed with chemically modified synthetic single guide RNA (sgRNA) to immortalized adherent cells or suspension cells. RNP delivery is accomplished using the Lonza 4D NucleofectorTM unit with 16-well NucleocuvetteTM Strips. A option for knock-in is included. Chemically modified sgRNAs are designed to resist exonucleases and innate intracellular immune cascades that can lead to cell death. Synthego chemically modified synthetic sgRNAs are of exceptional purity and consistently drive high editing efficiencies.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":293,"length":2,"style":"sup"},{"offset":327,"length":2,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

materials.reagent_name: Positive control (optional); Recommended: human RELA sgRNA, CDC42BPB sgRNA
Transfection control (optional); Recommended: pMAX GFP (Lonza), GFP mRNA (SBI)
4D-Nucleofector® X Kit S (32 RCT) specific for cell type
TrypLE Express or preferred cell dissociation reagent

warning: Please refer to the SDS (Safety Data Sheet) for safety warnings and hazard information.
guidelines:
{"blocks":[{"key":"7iqte","text":" Abbreviations:
  
 CRISPR: clustered regularly interspaced short palindromic repeats Cas9: CRISPR associated protein 9
sgRNA: single guide RNA
RNP: ribonucleoprotein
 PCR: polymerase chain reaction
ICE: inference of CRISPR edits
FACS: fluorescence-activated cell sorting ssODNs: single-stranded donor oligonucleotides HDR: homology-directed repair
TE: Tris EDTA
PBS: phosphate-buffered saline
GFP: green fluorescent protein
  
  Important Considerations
  
 Working with RNA and RNPs
  Wearing gloves and using nuclease-free tubes and reagents is recommended in order to avoid RNase contamination.
 Always maintain sterile technique, and use sterile, filter pipette tips.
 All Synthego and NucleofectorTM reagents should be stored according to the manufacturer’s recommendations.
 Synthetic sgRNA should be dissolved in TE buffer and diluted to a working concentration using nuclease-free water. Please consult the Synthego Quick Start Guide for best practices related to dissolving and storing synthetic sgRNAs.
 RNPs can be formed directly in NucleofectorTM solution.
 RNP complexes are stable at room temperature for up to 1 hour (may be stored at 4°C for up to one week, or at -20°C for up to 1 month). Note that RNPs stored at 4°C may become susceptible to contamination from microbial growth after long periods of time.
   
   Suggested Controls

    Additional Information
  
 For an up-to-date list of all Synthego Protocols and other resources, please visit synthego.com/resources
  
 For technical assistance, contact our Scientific Support Team:
  
 Ph: 888.611.6883
 Email: support@synthego.com

steps.data:
{"blocks":[{"key":"bi9u4","text":"Subculture cells 2 days before nucleofection and seed cells in an appropriately sized vessel so that they are 70-80% confluent on the day of transfection. Each nucleofection reaction will require ~1.5 x 105 cells. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":205,"length":1,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3hoh1","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"8c1o7","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"f3ver","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":"

Culturing cells for additional days may be necessary to reach the desired confluency.

"},{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"18383","duration":"172800","label":"Subculturing cells","guid":"022DB3C64ADE49CE8E6C111F7CEFF380"}}],"guid":"1FD874995B3E4EAF82C887D4FFA305C4","id":655491,"previous_id":null,"previous_guid":null,"section":"Pre-Nucleofection - Seed Cells"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4559u","text":" Pre-warm 1 ml of normal growth medium in each well of a 12-well cell culture plate per reaction.\u00a0\n ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1m0g3","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"7htom","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"9068","amount":"1","unit":"2","label":"normal growth medium","guid":"16EFD1B457C84219A18D99A853B2E520"}},{"type":"notes","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"0":"<","1":"p","2":">","3":"T","4":"h","5":"i","6":"s","7":" ","8":"w","9":"i","10":"l","11":"l","12":" ","13":"s","14":"e","15":"r","16":"v","17":"e","18":" ","19":"a","20":"s","21":" ","22":"t","23":"h","24":"e","25":" ","26":"d","27":"e","28":"s","29":"t","30":"i","31":"n","32":"a","33":"t","34":"i","35":"o","36":"n","37":" ","38":"p","39":"l","40":"a","41":"t","42":"e","43":" ","44":"a","45":"f","46":"t","47":"e","48":"r","49":" ","50":"n","51":"u","52":"c","53":"l","54":"e","55":"o","56":"f","57":"e","58":"c","59":"t","60":"i","61":"o","62":"n","63":".","64":"<","65":"\/","66":"p","67":">","blocks":[{"key":"cm9rp","text":"This will serve as the destination plate after nucleofection.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":61,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"DA745C2BC3A4471C81F5B3D6141DDEC1","id":655495,"previous_id":655491,"previous_guid":"1FD874995B3E4EAF82C887D4FFA305C4","section":"Setup & Nucleofection - Prepare Destination Plate"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9rii6","text":" In appropriate plates/tubes, assemble RNP complexes in the order shown below. Synthego recommends sgRNA:Cas9 ratios between 3:1 and 9:1 for RNP formation. Below is an example experiment using a sgRNA:Cas9 ratio of 9:1.
     
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bceni","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"42bjt","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"92tke","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1ejbk","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"bbkt2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4s0vp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"29939","guid":"63E5DE00BBAF11E886D825E2E40A1390","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/7hv3g3e.png","placeholder":"","original_name":"Screen Shot 2018-09-18 at 6.56.15 PM.png","mime":"image/png","width":null,"height":null,"is_video":false}},{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"3gl0d","text":"Knock-in Option: to knock in small inserts (<50 bp), an ssDNA HDR Template can be added. The recommended length of each homology arm is at least 50 bp. Add 1 µl 60 µM ssDNA HDR Template per reaction to each well. Optimization may be required. To knock in larger inserts and for more information on designing knock-in experiments, see Tips and Tricks: Design and Optimization of CRISPR Knock-in Experiments.
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":15,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":334,"length":72,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"46gta","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"925CC0B0BB9A11E8BFA60F0464892A8F","url":"https://www.synthego.com/resources/designing-crispr-knock-in-experiments"}}]}}],"guid":"B72F9D1614F44917829DEA9723F600F8","id":655496,"previous_id":655495,"previous_guid":"DA745C2BC3A4471C81F5B3D6141DDEC1","section":"Setup & Nucleofection - Assemble RNP Complexes (9:1 sgRNA to Cas9 ratio) "}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ae679","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eid6k","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"5mdbk","text":"Aspirate cell culture medium and wash cells 1-2 times with appropriate volume of 1X concentration of PBS. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"20seh","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"dnigq","text":"For suspension cells: spin down cells before each aspiration of culture medium and washes (step 5). Skip steps 6 and 7 below. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":105,"style":"italic"},{"offset":106,"length":20,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}},{"type":"notes","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":"

Do not shake or hit the flask to dislodge cells, as this may lead to clumping and inaccuracies in cell counting.

"}],"guid":"5E8C5E7C25E6440B9190827CC6261F51","id":655498,"previous_id":665509,"previous_guid":"BC61DFA0BBAC11E886D825E2E40A1390","section":"Setup & Nucleofection - Prepare Cell Suspension"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9vcsh","text":"Add appropriate amount of TrypLE Express and incubate the cells for ~5 minutes, or until they detach from the plate completely.
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"73l6f","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"18346","duration":"300","label":"Incubation","guid":"47B2151917D143B4B47FBDCCBDFAA727"}}],"guid":"CD71BC83B0934530833B77E1F214B3B5","id":655499,"previous_id":655498,"previous_guid":"5E8C5E7C25E6440B9190827CC6261F51","section":"Setup & Nucleofection - Prepare Cells"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1kpna","text":"   Neutralize the dissociation reaction with at least 2X volume of normal growth medium.
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2pltj","text":" Count the cells to determine the cell density.
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"8F8F9220CEEC4B08BE0DF22C0F596A55","id":655501,"previous_id":655500,"previous_guid":"9DFAB03C786B42C6B4E048BE97D067A7","section":"Setup & Nucleofection - Prepare Cell Suspension"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7rfvv","text":" Aliquot enough cells to have 1.5 x 105 cells/reaction.
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":38,"length":1,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"2C230EC39B7F4964A31ABFADA6632A2D","id":655502,"previous_id":655501,"previous_guid":"8F8F9220CEEC4B08BE0DF22C0F596A55","section":"Setup & Nucleofection - Prepare Cell Suspension"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1vh51","text":"Add 5 \u03bcl of cell suspension to 25 \u03bcl of RNP solution to make 30 \u03bcl of cell-RNP solution per reaction.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a5lrm","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"eu1f5","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"9070","amount":"5","unit":"1","label":"cell suspension","guid":"8BB9D163672944CF978271F1DDA23CBA"}},{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"9071","amount":"25","unit":"1","label":"RNP solution","guid":"21A1A9391E9741369F190F3A8330C15D"}}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"839dm","text":"For each reaction, transfer all 30 \u03bcl of cell-RNP solution to a well of the NucleocuvetteTM strip and click the lid into place.\n ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":89,"length":2,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"3EE49CE0EF5B41408C4986CF4094BD7C","id":655509,"previous_id":655508,"previous_guid":"D350C0EB44B04742B7CE4EB99558B050","section":"Setup & Nucleofection - Transfer Cell\/RNP Solution to the Nucleocuvette Strip"}
steps.section: Setup & Nucleofection - Transfer Cell/RNP Solution to the Nucleocuvette Strip

steps.data:
{"blocks":[{"key":"35g4l","text":"Gently tap the NucleocuvetteTM strip on the benchtop to make sure that each sample covers the bottom of each well and that there are no bubbles in the wells.
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":28,"length":2,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"20B1F9015F8C4FBB8385116B5CCE2505","id":655510,"previous_id":655509,"previous_guid":"3EE49CE0EF5B41408C4986CF4094BD7C","section":"Setup & Nucleofection - Transfer Cell/RNP Solution to the Nucleocuvette Strip"}
steps.section: Setup & Nucleofection - Transfer Cell/RNP Solution to the Nucleocuvette Strip

steps.data:
{"blocks":[{"key":"2hrr","text":" Place the NucleocuvetteTM strip with closed lid into the retainer of the 4D-X Core unit. Check for proper orientation of the NucleocuvetteTM strip. Larger cutout is the top (A1 and A2) and smaller cutout is the bottom (H1 and H2).
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":24,"length":2,"style":"sup"},{"offset":139,"length":2,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"BA1AF68E13FA4E51851F10C846B35CBD","id":655512,"previous_id":655511,"previous_guid":"F4F27D3260B74E26874AE647828B28CA","section":"Setup & Nucleofection - Transfect Cells"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"97hm3","text":"Carefully resuspend the cells in each well of the NucleocuvetteTM strip with 70 \u03bcl of pre-warmed growth medium, and mix gently by pipetting up and down 2-3 times.\n ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":63,"length":2,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5ghtj","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"9072","amount":"70","unit":"1","label":"pre-warmed growth medium","guid":"E0FBE111F1BD4C5B8410ED72251CCB1C"}}],"guid":"80C0FC5B291C457889B7D33C9FE32BA9","id":655514,"previous_id":655513,"previous_guid":"160CCD63F45F4D08910CD5A78532A669","section":"Setup & Nucleofection - Add Recovery Medium"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"as9tb","text":"Transfer all 100 \u03bcl to the pre-warmed 12-well tissue culture plate (prepared in step 2)\n ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"43DA69C444D541AD99D7BD486D61A67F","id":655515,"previous_id":655514,"previous_guid":"80C0FC5B291C457889B7D33C9FE32BA9","section":"Setup & Nucleofection - Plate Cells"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b0lh8","text":"   Incubate the cells for 2-3 days in a humidified 37°C/5% CO2 incubator.
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":61,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2qq8d","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"ab11r","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"2991","temperature":"37","unit":"10","label":"Incubation","guid":"466FC8CADFA849999A3B234706D559A2"}},{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"18349","duration":"172800","label":"Incubation","guid":"29E3A4DE363D425F9776B7ECEDC8CDD2"}}]}

Next-Gen Sequencing, FACS, or functional tests may be conducted as alternatives.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6imp9","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"4n9v5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"https:\/\/www.synthego.com\/products\/bioinformatics\/crispr-analysis"}},{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"mvvd","text":"Option: If storing cells for future use is desired, split cells into two groups (one for analysis and one for cell culture).    ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"FA7CE250BBA011E8BFA60F0464892A8F","id":665472,"previous_id":665473,"previous_guid":"206467E0BBA111E8BFA60F0464892A8F","section":"Post-Nucleofection - Analysis"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4kh8d","text":"Extract DNA from cells 48 hours after transfection. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"206467E0BBA111E8BFA60F0464892A8F","id":665473,"previous_id":655516,"previous_guid":"94A17DC5A8CC4231B9FD107954F6647E","section":"Post-Nucleofection - Analysis"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6570n","text":"Incubate RNPs for 10 minutes at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"BC61DFA0BBAC11E886D825E2E40A1390","id":665509,"previous_guid":"B72F9D1614F44917829DEA9723F600F8","section":"Setup & Nucleofection - Assemble RNP Complexes (9:1 sgRNA to Cas9 ratio) "}
